description: The bright green flesh of the Kiwi with tiny black seeds gives a tropical flair to any fruit salad. It is almost creamy in consistency and has a pleasant sweet taste.
Green Apple, also known as Granny Smith is crisp with lemon-like tartness. It is firm, medium grained and has bright white flesh and is excellent for pie baking or can be eaten as whole.

Watermelon is a watery and pulpy fruit with a granular texture and a sugary taste, enveloped by a thick dark green skin. Usually relished as raw, this versatile fruit is juicy, crispy and irresistibly sweet. It can also be used to make juice, jam, sorbet, iced tea, etc.
Pomegranate has a juicy cluster of sparkling, opaque, red coloured seeds which taste sweet. It can be used for topping desserts and to make juices and fruit salads.
Packed with nutrition, Papaya is a pulpy fruit with a mild sweet taste. It can be relished as it is or can be sliced with other fruits for a healthy fruit salad.
Sun Melon is a juicy and sweet fruit and has fewer seeds than other melons. A member of the melon family, it has a yellow-coloured skin and is generally sweet and soft with an aroma of bubble gum.
Brown coconuts have firm white meat and less water than green coconuts. The meat is used to flavour many dishes and is a commonly used ingredient in South Indian dishes.
